column4: hey gang. my macbookpro5.3 has a OSX partition as well as a Ubuntu one. When I start the computer it auto boots to OSX. If I hold 'alt'on start I can select to boot from Ubuntu's grub partition (in the menu here it calls it "Windows" and my Linux file system directory seems to not be detected).
I'd like to have the macbook boot from grub by default (it's actually grub2) as linux is my main system now
is there some way to set which partition is booted from by default? I see that OSX has a '*' in the boot collumn when running fdisk -l
I could be mistaken, but I think that's a setting that will be in macOSX, as it handles the boot proprietarily
